alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 4:43PM CDT until September 02 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Yell County in central Arkansas... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 443 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Danville, Ola, Plainview in Yell County, Petit Jean River WMA, Birta, Kingston, Sunlight Bay Park, Carter Cove Park, Rover, Garden Point Recreation Area, Macedonia in Yell County and Wing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
